title: Why nerf mages instead of giving assassins teamfighting tools?
body:
Assassins are made to capitalize on mistakes, catch out opponents, but are vulnerable in teamfights.



...All things SoloQ has but LCS players will never allow.

A mage nerf won't stop them from being picked in LCS.

> Destroying the identity of champions would be nerfing defensive items for tanks because they survive too long.

no, that is not what destroying or even changing the identity of a class means. If they changed Tanks to be dps-focused, the very  purpose or *thing* they provide to a match, is what changing the identity of a class means. 

For more relevance: 
Nerfing lethality items or other assassin items would be a nerf to assassins, but wouldn't destroy their identity unless another build that supports a different playstyle+goal becomes more viable such as the "bruiser" assassin days when tank items were much more effective for assassins.

What *would* be a clear cut case of destroying the identity of assassins is by pushing them to be more teamfight-orientated champions.

It worries me that people don't know this though

For context in mages: Nerfing their waveclear does not ruin their identity, nor are all mages burst-focused (see Azir, Cass, etc). I want to point out that mages are much more diverse of a class than tanks or assassins and their "identity" is much more broader than either of those classes. Waveclear and CC are generally the only two things that define mages and neither of those things are being removed from the class, just nerfed, so their identity still exists.

Talon is fine for the most part against a lot of mages (at least, a lot of them are skill matches or he can push and roam).

He just needs help dealing with adc damage in the mid to late game.  Currently he'll only really kill the enemy adc in the late game (without dying himself) if he gets the drop on them without their support around and uses his ult.  If he doesn't get all those things, he'll at best go even, and often die without getting any kill.

Giving him a disarm would enable him to kill the enemy adc a bit more reliably later on in the game without dramatically increasing his ability to kill his lane opponent.
Talon is already pretty decent however. He’s supposed to fall off in exchange for his early and mid game power.

Assassins with Teamfighting tools exist, they're just labeled skirmishers/divers, and everyone hates them: {{champion:11}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:141}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:164}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:92}}

{{champion:55}} idk how she is now, but didn't they try to make her the aoe assassin?

I mean they do in solo-queue, but not against coordinated play.

I guess that's the real problem, the Venn Diagram of assassins with teamfight tools that function in coordinated play, and champions that ruin solo-queue and fill up the front pages of the boards with complaints is a circle. 

They get unbearable in solo-queue as they approach 35% winrate in pro-play (obviously a unchecked exaggeration, but it gets the point across). It's really hard to make a damage-oriented melee-champion that functions as such in pro play, can survive pro-level teamfights, and is anywhere remotely approaching fair in solo-queue, especially lower levels.

I think the real issue with assassins in pro play is that they are risky and require support from their team.  You suddenly need someone else to provide waveclear and you suddenly need someone else to do magic damage (usually).  Then the assassins themselves are high risk, high reward, and pro teams generally don't like taking risks.
Bring back silence on {{champion:91}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:38}}  , and give some disarms to some others!.

I mean the answer is so obvious I don't see why not have silence in this game, removing it was just a scrub change to begin with and it will make these characters viable again.

I don't see why it isn't fair in a game with airborne, stun, and suprression, 3 statis effects that don't allow you to do *anything* to not have silences (you can move, you can attack, you just can't cast!).

Of course they'd have to adjust around Talon, Kassadin, and LeBlanc if they had Silences again but it would be totally worth it and make the game far more interesting.

As for disarm, which is a fantastic anti-adc cc, who do you think should have it?
I'd say; Zed.. the disarm in his ult. It would be a neat bit of utility for him.

Actually I think disarm would make sense on assassins to a degree, so long as they aren't spammable.  It wouldn't stop enemies from kiting/cc locking assassins, wouldn't help them much against mages (where it seems they don't need help), and it would help them survive long enough against an adc and support for it to be possible for them to pull off their burst.

In the case of against support and adc, they'd still lose if they get hit by cc and shields would suck for them, but they may still manage the kill if they evade some or all of the cc.
